revised_title: The Royal Society's Connection with the Chelsea Physic Garden
tldr: This article discusses the historical connection between the Royal Society and the Chelsea Physic Garden, focusing on the annual submission of dried plant specimens from the garden to the Royal Society between 1722 and 1799. The specimens provide valuable evidence of the plants grown in the garden during that time and contribute to the understanding of botanical history and plant introductions.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
